sanskrit_verse:
बिडालकाकाखूच्छिष्टं जग्ध्वा श्वनकुलस्य च ।
केशकीटावपन्नं च पिबेद्ब्रह्मसुवर्चलाम् ॥ ११.१५९॥
transliteration:
biḍālakākākhūcchiṣṭaṁ jagdhvā śvanakulasya ca |
keśakīṭāvapannaṁ ca pibed brahmasuvarcalām || 11.159 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who has consumed remnants of cat, crow, dog, or louse-infested hair shall drink the Brahma-suvarcalā water to restore purity and dissolve karmic misalignment.
jurisprudential_principles: Causation is traced through sensory and karmic contamination
Capacity-based responsibility arises from conscious ingestion
Restoration logic operates through elemental purification
Consciousness alignment requires dissolution of impure patterning
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent_ingests(remnant(cat) OR remnant(crow) OR remnant(dog) OR remnant(hair_infested_with_louse)) THEN initiate_purification(brahma_suvarcalā)
supreme_court_application: In matters involving ritual or sensory contamination, the threshold for responsibility lies in voluntary or aware ingestion. The court must recognize that the contaminant is not merely physical but carries karmic patterning requiring purification via prescribed dharmic agents like Brahma-suvarcalā. Authority resides in restoring constitutional consciousness, not assigning fault.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that ingestion creates sequential karmic imprinting (anupūrvaśaḥ). Responsibility is proportional to awareness at time of ingestion. The prescribed remedy aligns individual consciousness with cosmic purity without punitive intent. The act of drinking Brahma-suvarcalā dissolves misalignment rather than inflicting consequence.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate purification protocol using Brahma-suvarcalā under supervision of qualified Vedic practitioner
Monitor consciousness resonance post-consumption to confirm energetic cleansing
Assign completion process: recitation of relevant hymns until purity-consciousness stabilizes
Reintegrate individual into community upon attestation of restored integrity
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. Purity is restored through consciousness-aligned action. Justice flows from realignment, not retribution. Reality is non-punitive; consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
